questions.text: Is climate action the core purpose or goal of the policy?
questions.answer: The policy, titled 'Our Climate Emergency Response Strategy 2021–2025', clearly identifies climate action as its core purpose. The policy outlines a comprehensive plan to integrate climate action into all aspects of the local government's operations. It sets out 70 actions to be undertaken over the life of the strategy to achieve the identified goals and objectives. The policy is designed to be broad, capturing a wide range of specific actions, programs, and projects that the Council will undertake over four years. These actions are to be translated each year into specific actions, programs, or projects and integrated into annual work plans across the Council. This approach ensures that climate change action is truly integrated into everything the Council does. The policy also includes a Monitoring and Evaluation section, which contains a set of key questions, indicators, and targets for each goal. This section will be used to track progress and make necessary adjustments to the policy.

quote.content: The actions will be translated each year into these specific actions, programs or projects and integrated into annual work plans right across Council to ensure climate change action is truly integrated into everything we do. The Strategy is support by Our Action Plan, which sets out 70 actions to be undertaken over the life of the Strategy to achieve the identified goals and objectives. The actions are deliberately broad, as they capture a wide range of specific actions, programs and projects Council will undertake over the four years.

questions.text: Does the document explicitly call for rapid and urgent action on climate change?
questions.answer: The documents provided by the Glen Eira City Council clearly call for rapid and urgent action on climate change. The council acknowledges the current state of climate change and its impacts, and emphasizes the need for immediate action. The council declared a climate emergency in May 2020, demonstrating their recognition of the urgency of the situation. They have committed to work harder to address climate change at a local level and to advocate to State and Federal Governments for urgent action. The documents also highlight the need for a clear strategy to guide their efforts and to ensure they stay on track. The council's goals and objectives, as well as their action plan, further underscore their commitment to urgent action on climate change.

quote.content: So far, local, national and global action has not been enough to overcome the scale and urgency of the problem. Urgent climate change action is essential to help us secure our Glen Eira community vision: a thriving and empowered community working together for an inclusive and sustainable future. Climate change is happening right now and we have all experienced the impacts. Without concerted efforts across the globe, these impacts will only worsen.

questions.answer: The documents provide clear evidence that the local government is actively empowering and educating the community to rally, support, and work together to deliver climate action. questions.text: Does the plan include specific actions for mitigation of greenhouse gas emissions, including technological solutions and behaviour change?
questions.answer: The local government's climate emergency response strategy indeed includes specific actions for the mitigation of greenhouse gas emissions. The plan outlines a two-pronged approach: mitigation, which involves reducing carbon emissions, and adaptation, which involves preparing for the economic, social, and environmental shocks expected due to climate change. The strategy sets clear targets for achieving net zero corporate emissions by 2025 and net zero community emissions by 2030. Technological solutions are also mentioned, such as the installation of solar panels to generate clean renewable energy on-site. The plan also includes actions to change behaviour, such as incorporating climate change messages and education into related subject areas like public health, transport, and youth. The strategy also aims to review and update the Council’s website to ensure climate change messaging appears throughout, and to create opportunities for everyone in the community to act on climate change.

questions.text: Does the plan include specific actions for climate adaptation and resilience?
questions.answer: The local government's plan indeed includes specific actions for climate adaptation and resilience. The policy outlines a comprehensive approach to building local resilience and adaptive capacity, both within its own operations and across the broader community. This includes investing in urban greening and biodiversity, adapting buildings, assets, and infrastructure to future-proof against the growing environmental and financial impacts of climate change, and ensuring safety for all users. The policy also outlines a plan to support residents and businesses to insulate themselves against climate change impacts, including understanding the local population segments who are particularly exposed to climate change risks, investing in services and partnerships to support the most vulnerable community members, and engaging and educating residents and business owners about how they can best adapt to and protect themselves and their community against climate impacts. The policy also includes a timeline for these actions, indicating a clear commitment to implementing them.

quote.content: For our own operations, this will focus on building natural capital (through investment in urban greening and biodiversity) and adapting our buildings, assets and infrastructure to ensure that they are future proofed against the growing environmental and financial impacts of climate change and are safe for all users. We will continue to build local resilience and adaptive capacity, within our own operations but also across and with the broader community.
